intro: Bureavella villamilii, commonly known as the Malacca starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Malaysia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
